message.entry: Invalid OMPL object used as an argument. Expected objects of type:\n{0}
{0} is not compatible with a 2D state space. Expected the vector to have dimensions [{1,number,integer}, {2,number,integer}].
{0} is not a valid boundary, the lower bound is greater than or equal to the upper boundary.
{0} falls outside of the bounds of the defined state space. Truncating to fit within the defined limits of the state space.
Occupancy Map has not yet been assigned, the planner will solve under the assumption that all states in the designated state space are valid
No path information exists as no solution has been found yet. Either "solve" has not yet been called, or it was unsuccessful in finding a valid path.
Data is non-finite (Inf or -Inf), expected finite value.
Data is Not A Number (NaN), expected a real number input
Invalid map data. Expected map data to have dimension {0}, instead the map data had dimension {1}.
No solution exists yet. Either solve has not been called, or the planner was unable to find a valid solution to the planning problem.
The time to solve for a path is larger than or equal to the specified timeout, the solution provided may be incomplete
A solution was not able to be calculated for the problem as defined. Please review the parameters to ensure that there exists a possible path to the goal state
Invalid planner type for OmplInterface.PlannerType. Choices are: {0}.
Invalid state space type for OmplInterface.StateSpaceType. Choices are: {0}.
